DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Participating Organization National Cancer Institute Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number or code assigned by the National Cancer Institute to an organization or institution participating on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Participating Organization National Cancer Institute Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the identifier assigned by the National Cancer Institute, the U.S. Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research and  conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer, to an institution or organization participating on a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:Taking part in an activity.:A formal group of people with one or more shared goals.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
The act of taking part in an activity.
A formal group of people that exists to further a particular profession.

Property.preferredDefinition: NCI.  The National Cancer Institute, part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, is the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research.  NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer.  Access the NCI Web site at http://cancer.gov.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: The Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer. Part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Participating Organization National Cancer Institute Identifier Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric identifier assigned by the NCI to a participating organization or institution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
